ImageData.LabelName: Stage II Nonmelanoma Skin Cancer of the Head and Neck
Tumor is larger than 2 cm but not larger than 4 cm

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Added "of the Head and Neck" to the title
Moved the "Cancer" label over a bit
Changed text in inset box to "Tumor is larger than 2 cm but not larger than 4 cm"
Made the lines from the shaded box go into the top part of the yellow tumor; removed the second “is” in the inset box
Added Skin Cancer to the title

Moved the label for Cancer outside the box, and made the cancer spot a little larger; changed the wording in the inset to “Tumor is at least 2 cm but is smaller than 4 cm”, and added the shaded cone connecting to the main figure
Image revisions made per AJCC 8th edition updates
Changed title from Stage II nonmelanoma skin cancer to: Stage II Nonmelanoma Skin Cancer

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage II nonmelanoma skin cancer of the head and neck; drawing shows cancer in the epidermis and the dermis. An inset shows that the tumor is larger than 2 centimeters but not larger than 4 centimeters and that 2 centimeters is about the size of a peanut and 4 centimeters is about the size of a walnut. Also shown is the subcutaneous tissue below the dermis.

Stage II nonmelanoma skin cancer of the head and neck; drawing shows cancer in the epidermis and the dermis. An inset shows that the tumor is larger than 2 centimeters but not larger than 4 centimeters and that 2 centimeters is about the size of a peanut and 4 centimeters is about the size of a walnut. Also shown is the subcutaneous tissue below the dermis.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage II nonmelanoma skin cancer of the head and neck. The tumor is larger than 2 centimeters but not larger than 4 centimeters.
Stage II nonmelanoma skin cancer of the head and neck. The tumor is larger than 2 centimeters but not larger than 4 centimeters.

ProposedUse.Glossary: stage II nonmelanoma skin cancer on the head and neck (not on the eyelid)
